titleStmt.title: W. P. Baker to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2192

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Hawesville Ky.
Sept 11th 1865
his Excellency Gov Bramlett.
Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir

There is a vacancy in the Office of Justice of the peace in the 2d District for Hancock. County occasioned by the election of myself to the Office of Presiding Judge of the County Court,= consequently the vacancy has to be filled by appointment by your Excellency -- I would therefore respectfully recommend Joseph F. Wilson Esq as a suitable person to fill said office --

Very Respectfully Your
obedient Servant,
W. P. Baker. Co Judge

We the undersigned, Citizens of Hancock County, would respectfully petition your excellency to appoint to the Joseph F Wilson Justice of the peace for the 2d Justices district for Hancock, County. believing him to be a person well Suited for the office.

W. S. Thomas J H. C
James E Stone Co. atty.
E H Brown P. J. Hawesville
E E Pate Clerk H Cir & Co Ct
Philip Z. James
Marshall Hancock

Justice Peace
Hancock Co
Jos F. Wilson
Apptd 13 Sept/65
